Introduction.What is Rythm Bot?: Rythm is a feature-rich, high-performance music bot for Discord, specially designed to deliver high quality music, stability and ease of use while also providing advanced music functionalities in order to create the ultimate music bot experience.
Introduction.How do I add Rythm to my server?:
You can add Rythm to your Discord server by using the following link:


https://discord.io/rythm


Note: You need to be an Admin in the server OR have a role with “Manage server” permission to be able to add Rythm to a Discord Server. Also make sure you’re logged in into the right account in the web browser.
Introduction.What is Rythm's Discord Server for?:
Rythm’s Discord server is the official platform for everything related to Rythm bot.

Here you’ll be able to:

• See Information about Rythm’s latest features and updates.
• Keep up with all the news and announcements.
• Hang out with the members of our fast growing community!
• Suggest new features for the bot.
• Get support from our Staff members.

Note: For an invite to Rythm's Discord server, use the following link: https://discord.io/botz

Basics.How can I play a song with Rythm?:
To play a song use the following command format:

!play [songname/URL]

Example: !play retrograde

For a full list of commands type !help in your server with Rythm in it.
Basics.Where can I find a list of all Rythm Com:
You can see a list of commands by typing !help in your server, or by visiting the following link:

https://rythmbot.co/#commands

Note: In order to execute any command, you must type the bot's prefix followed by the command. The default prefix for Rhythm is: !
Basics.How do I change the Bot's Nickname?:
To change the bot’s nickname in your server you must:

1) Right Click on the bot > Change nickname > Save.

Done.
Basics.Can I change the Bot's avatar?:
Short answer: No.

The bot’s Avatar/Profile picture can’t be changed. This is due to a Discord limitation.
Basics.How do I change the Bot's Prefix?:
To change the bot’s prefix use the following command format:

!settings prefix [NewPrefix]

Example: !settings prefix +
Basics.Does Rythm play 24/7?:
Short answer: No.

Rythm is not a 24/7 bot. However, you can host your own bot to access such feature.
Basics.Can I make a playlist with Rythm?:
Rythm can reproduce playlists from a variety of online audio sources including youtube and soundcloud.

To add songs to the queue from an online playlist, use the following command format:

!play [URL]

Example: !play https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P2l0lbn5TVg&list=PL2788304DC59DBEB4
Basics.Why can some normal users access importa:
Normal users with no special permissions are only allowed to use the
!play command to add songs to the queue by default.
They can also use other commands that don't affect the playing music in any way. Example: !queue and !lyrics.

However, Normal users can access ALL music commands when they are alone with the bot in the voice channel.
This is because their commands would not affect anyone but themselves.
Basics.How do I change the channel where Rythm:
Rythm announces the songs in the same text channel it was originally called from.

If you summon Rythm in channel #general, all Announce Songs messages will appear in that channel.

To change the channel where it’ll show the messages, just !disconnect Rythm from the current channel and !summon it in the channel you want the songs to be announced in.

Basics.Can I have 2 Rythms in the same server?:
Short answer: No.

Discord doesn’t allow 2 instances of the same bot running within one server.

A message should be returned by Rythm stating its current prefix.
